alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 26 at 4:21AM CDT until July 26 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois, including the following areas, Clinton IL and Madison IL. Portions of Missouri, including the following areas, Boone MO, Callaway MO, Montgomery MO, Saint Charles MO, Saint Louis City MO, Saint Louis MO and Warren MO. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall continue to train over sections of central and east-central Missouri, as well as southwest Illinois. Widespread amounts of 1 to 4 inches have been observed with localized amounts exceeding 9 inches. Thunderstorms are expected to continue through early this morning adding to these totals.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
